{{Content Developers Trail|Stoll}}'''Robert Stoll''' was a game designer at [[General:Bethesda Softworks|Bethesda Softworks]] , and helped conceive the overall worldbuilding and narrative of ''[[Daggerfall:Daggerfall|Daggerfall]]'' lead designer[[General:Ted Peterson|Ted Peterson]]

==Bethsoft Credits==
==Bethsoft Credits==
Latest revision as of 01:48, 12 July 2024
|Robert Stoll|
|Role(s)||
|
Robert Stoll was a game designer at
[Bethesda Softworks](/wiki/General:Bethesda_Softworks) in the mid 1990s, and helped conceive the overall worldbuilding and narrative of [Daggerfall](/wiki/Daggerfall:Daggerfall) in collaboration with that project's lead designer, [Ted Peterson](/wiki/General:Ted_Peterson).
According to Peterson, Stoll took creative inspiration from the tabletop game
RuneQuest.
Bethsoft Credits[
[edit](/w/index.php?title=General:Robert_Stoll&action=edit§ion=1)] The Terminator: Future Shock— Original Story and Design PBA Bowling)— Thanks [The Elder Scrolls II: Daggerfall](/wiki/Daggerfall:Daggerfall)— Design (uncredited)
